sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Short Interest in Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) Increases By 423.9%
feed.summary: Short interest in Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) saw a significant increase of 423.9% by December 15th, reaching 854 shares. Despite this jump, the short interest still represents a very small percentage of the company's shares. Analyst sentiment towards HYAC remains negative, with an average "Sell" rating and institutional investors showing mixed activity, including some increasing their stakes significantly.

feed.title: Karpus Management Inc. Has $7.45 Million Position in Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 $HYAC
feed.summary: Karpus Management Inc. trimmed its stake in Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) by 20% in the second quarter, now holding 671,025 shares valued at $7.45 million. Concurrently, Wolverine Asset Management LLC increased its position by 34.2%, owning 1,002,049 shares worth $11.12 million. Institutional investors and hedge funds collectively own 71.07% of the stock, which currently trades around $11.32 and has a consensus "Sell" rating from analysts.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 Merges with Suncrete
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (HYAC) announced its merger with Suncrete, Inc. through a business combination agreement entered on October 9, 2025. This strategic merger aims to enhance Suncrete’s market presence in the U.S. Sunbelt, with the agreement contingent on shareholder and regulatory approval. Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 is a Cayman Islands exempted company, and Suncrete, Inc. is a Delaware corporation specializing in ready-mix concrete in the U.S. Sunbelt region.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 Announces Suncrete Merger
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 and Suncrete, Inc. announced a Business Combination Agreement to list Suncrete on the New York Stock Exchange, expected to close in Q1 2026. This strategic move aims to position Suncrete as a leading publicly traded ready-mix concrete platform in the Sunbelt region, supported by a $82.5 million private placement for growth. Suncrete, operating in Oklahoma and Arkansas, plans to expand its market share through organic growth and acquisitions across the rapidly growing U.S. Sunbelt.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 $HYAC Shares Acquired by Wolverine Asset Management LLC
feed.summary: Wolverine Asset Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) by 34.2% in Q2, now holding over one million shares valued at $11.1 million. Mizuho Securities USA LLC also boosted its position, contributing to hedge funds owning 71.07% of the company. Despite institutional interest, the stock currently carries an average "Sell" rating from analysts.

feed.title: Weiss Ratings Reaffirms "Sell (D)" Rating for Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC)
feed.summary: Weiss Ratings has reaffirmed a "Sell (D)" rating for Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC), signaling continued concerns about the company's stock performance. This contrasts with Wall Street Zen's recent upgrade of HYAC from "sell" to "hold". Institutional investors hold a significant portion of the company's shares, with notable recent purchases by firms like Mizuho Securities USA LLC and JPMorgan Chase & Co.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 Completes Suncrete Acquisition
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 has completed its acquisition of Schwarz Ready Mix, significantly expanding Suncrete's operations into the Oklahoma City metro area. This strategic move adds 20 ready-mix plants and over 100 mixer trucks, strengthening Suncrete’s position in the Sunbelt region's ready-mix industry. The acquisition aligns with Suncrete's growth strategy to enhance its market reach and asset base across Oklahoma and Arkansas.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) Short Interest Down 92.3% in September - MarketBeat
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 (NYSE:HYAC) experienced a significant 92.3% decrease in short interest during September, falling to 100 shares. Despite a consensus "Sell" rating from analysts, institutional investors hold a substantial portion of the stock, with some firms increasing their positions. The article also provides details on the company's stock performance and profile.

feed.title: Haymaker Acquisition 4 to Pursue Business Combination With Sun Tx Capital's Concrete Partners
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition 4 is reportedly pursuing a business combination with Sun Tx Capital's Concrete Partners. Alongside this news, Unity Software (U.US) announced its fourth-quarter results, reporting revenue of $609 million, a 35% year-over-year increase, and a quarterly loss of 66 cents per share.

feed.title: SunTx Capital Partners' Portfolio Company, Suncrete, to Pursue Listing on the New York Stock Exchange through a Proposed Business Combination with Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4
feed.summary: SunTx Capital Partners' portfolio company, Suncrete, a ready-mix concrete logistics and distribution platform, announced its intention to pursue a listing on the New York Stock Exchange through a proposed business combination with Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4. The transaction, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to capitalize on the fragmented U.S. ready-mix concrete industry and expand Suncrete's presence in the high-growth Sunbelt region. The combined company, to be named Suncrete, Inc., anticipates an enterprise value of approximately $972.6 million, supported by a common stock private placement of $82.5 million from institutional investors.

feed.title: (HYAC) Long Term Investment Analysis
authors: Scott B. - Contributor; Thomas H. Kee Jr.
feed.summary: This article provides a long-term investment analysis for Haymaker Acquisition Corp. 4 Class A (NASDAQ: HYAC) based on technical analysis. It highlights opportunities for traders watching stock price oscillations, emphasizes the dynamic nature of support and resistance levels, and introduces proprietary AI-generated signals for trading decisions. The report also mentions essential tools for subscribers like real-time updates, market analysis, and risk management through Evitar Corte.
